title.narrative: Honduras Early Childhood Education Improvement Project

description.narrative: The objectives of the Project are to improve (a) SE’s institutional capacity for preschool management; (b) teaching practices of preschool teachers and Educators; and (c) physical learning environments in preschools serving children in Targeted Areas.

condition.narrative: Schedule 2. Section I. A. 1. To facilitate implementation of the Project, the Recipient, through SE, shall:a) Establish, andthereafter, operate and maintain, throughout Project implementation an executive committee (the “Executive Committee”) responsiblefor Project oversight and coordination, led by SE’s under-secretariat of technical-pedagogical affairs, and with the composition,functions and resources set forth in the Project Operational Manual.

Schedule 2. Section I. A. 1. To facilitate implementation of the Project, the Recipient, through SE, shall:b) Establish, andthereafter, operate and maintain, throughout Project implementation, a Project implementation unit (“PIU”) within SE, with thestaffing, functions and resources acceptable to the Association, and adequate staff, including the staff mentioned in paragraph (c)of this Section.

Schedule 2. Section I. A. 1. To facilitate implementation of the Project, the Recipient, through SE, shall:c) Without limitationof the provisions of (b) above, no later than: (i) thirty (30) days after the Effective Date, hire a Project coordinator, afinancial management specialist, and a procurement specialist; (ii) sixty (60) days after the Effective Date, hire or appoint anenvironmental specialist and a social specialist; and (iii) ninety (90) days after the Effective Date, complete the hiring of therest of the remaining staff of the PIU identified in the Project Operational Manual, all in accordance with qualifications,experience and terms of reference set forth in the Project Operational Manual.

Schedule 2. Section I. C. 1. The Recipient, through SE, shall ensure that the Project is carried out in accordance with theEnvironmental and Social Standards, in a manner acceptable to the Association.

Schedule 2. Section I. D. 1. For purposes of carrying out Parts/Components 1 and 2 of the Project, the Recipient, through SE,shall:a) No later than a hundred and twenty (120) calendar days after the Effective Date, engage an Independent VerificationAgent with qualifications and experience, and under terms of reference acceptable to the Association.

Schedule 2. Section I. D. 1. For purposes of carrying out Parts/Components 1 and 2 of the Project, the Recipient, through SE,shall:b) Cause the Independent Verification Agent to: (a) carry out each calendar semester a verification of the level ofachievement of those DLRs as set forth in the Project Operational Manual; and (b) within thirty (30) days after the end of eachcalendar semester prepare and furnish to the Recipient, through SE, Independent Verification Reports of such scope and detail asset forth in the Project Operations Manual covering the pertinent calendar semester; and

Schedule 2. Section I. D. 1. For purposes of carrying out Parts/Components 1 and 2 of the Project, the Recipient, through SE,shall:c) Furnish a copy of each Independent Verification Report to the Association, no later than forty-five (45) days after theend of each calendar semester.

title.narrative: 3. Classrooms of preschool education centers in Targeted Areas with physical environments that meet quality conditions to promote learning
2. Participating preschool teachers and Educators with satisfactory teaching practices
1. Preschool Education Management Model (PEM) implemented at school-level (Depth indicator)
IRI 1: PEM approved and implemented at school level (Breadth indicator)

target.value: Comprehensive Preschool Education Management Model designed (C-PEM). The C-PEM articulates SE’s PEM, which is internal to thepreschool education sub-sector, with other education levels (initial and basic education), other sectors (health, nutrition, socialinclusion, etc.) and other more external actors.

title.narrative: IRI 2: Strengthened COMDEs and Activities carried out in Targeted Departments

target.value: All of the COMDEs in the 6 most disadvantaged departments trained in the Strengthening Program

title.narrative: IRI 3: Strengthened human resource capacity for preschool education management at the central and departmental levels

baseline.value: Functional Review including assessment of organizational structure and capacity of the human resources for preschool management.

target.value: Design and official approval by SE of a sustainable and long-term human resources strategy for public preschool teachers andEducators

actual.value: Functional Review including assessment of organizational structure and capacity of the human resources for preschool management.

title.narrative: IRI 14. Number of teachers and Educators trained on unit on gender-appropriate pedagogy within the In-service Teacher and Educator Training Program
IRI 15. Number of teachers and Educators trained on unit on adaptation measures for climate change within the In-service Teacher and Educator Training Program
IRI 16. Number of teachers and Educators trained on unit on prevention measures for school crime and violence within the In-serviceTeacher and Educator Training Program
IRI 11: Number of training workshops held on school maintenance in beneficiary schools.
IRI 10: Pre-investment education infrastructure studies for preschool developed
IRI 9: Preschool teachers and Educators that receive in-service training focused on pedagogical practices
IRI 6: Centers with the adequate amount of curricular tools
IRI 7: Centers with adequate learning materials
IRI 12: Centers in targeted municipalities selected based on the targeting criteria
IRI 8: Certified preschool teachers and Educators with improvements in their customized professional development plan, and Educators receiving bonus payments for certification

target.value: 470 teachers & Educators certified (3rd cohort); 50% of certified teachers and Educators (3rd cohort) with accredited improvementsin their customized professional development plan

title.narrative: IRI 13. Citizen Engagement Indicator: PEM - Teacher satisfaction survey – feedback received informs the future implementation of the PEM
IRI 4: Reformulation of SIPLAE and SACE
IRI 5: Design and improvement of the curriculum, curricular tools, and learning materials
Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning
